On topic: Do mods get a regular notification when something gets reported, or is it shown in some super-secret mod menu or likewise?

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> On topic: Do mods get a regular notification when something gets reported, or is it shown in some super-secret mod menu or likewise?
> 

We get notifications like you do for pings and stuff.
Have any of my posts ever been reported (besides the two I've gotten infractions for)? Just curious.

> 
> 
> 54 minutes ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> Have any of my posts ever been reported (besides the two I've gotten infractions for)? Just curious.
> 

I'm gonna go out on a limb and say they can't tell you.

> 
> 
> 49 minutes ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> I'm gonna go out on a limb and say they can't tell you.
> 

I assume so, too.

We generally don't discuss individual reports, for privacy reasons. Sometimes just knowing a report exists is enough for someone to deduce (sometimes erroneously) who reported it, and that can lead to hard feelings.

That said, [@legoclone09](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/142607-legoclone09/), you're a prolific poster and have strong opinions sometimes. I would not be surprised if some of your posts got reported and not moderated, some people are more sensitive than others or take a stricter interpretation of the rules than the moderation team does. For that matter, I get reported occasionally (as do some other mods), and even the Squad account has been reported a few times.

Yes, every time the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr> is edited the tag will be reset.

[@Red Iron Crown](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/12858-red-iron-crown/): Ok, if that's the case, don't worry about. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> I'm gonna go out on a limb and say they can't tell you.
> 

It all depends on if the report is considered as valid. If it's not a valid report (the post is not in violation of the rules), then you'd never know if it was reported, unless you self-reported a questionable post, as I have done on my own in the past. Yes, I've done this, especially when I do not know how close to the line my post has come... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, legoclone09 said:
> 
> 
> Have any of my posts ever been reported (besides the two I've gotten infractions for)? Just curious.
> 

The only way you'd know... and yeah, you've figured it out - is through the moderators' gifts of infractions. Unless it is self reported, then no, you'll never know.

Trust me, I write not as a mod, but as a frequent forum rule 2.2 violator... mostly for political commentary.

Is there someplace where unacceptable posts by users can be reported?

Same question, but for when moderators themselves make posts that violate forum rules?

> 
> 
> 47 minutes ago, mcortez said:
> 
> 
> Is there someplace where unacceptable posts by users can be reported?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Same question, but for when moderators themselves make posts that violate forum rules?
> 

If you look on the top of each post, there's a button that says "Report post." Click that, and give a reason why you're reporting it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") [/notamod]

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, mcortez said:
> 
> 
> Is there someplace where unacceptable posts by users can be reported?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Same question, but for when moderators themselves make posts that violate forum rules?
> 

What [@Dman979](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123837-dman979/) said; it's a light grey link just right of the "Posted 2 hours ago" line. When something is reported, it appears for us mods to discuss what to do about it (if anything). It's possible we take action on it and you never see it; we may not post anything in the thread in question, but have a (usually gentle) 1-on-1 with the offender instead (I say that because some people seem to *want* to see the other party being scolded in public; we try out best not to do that).

The same goes for moderator posts, too. After all, reported content goes for discussion of *all* mods, so it's possible one of us gets *the talk* from the rest. Most likely, however, our reaction will be more like "oh, really?" ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") 

I'd also like to say that reporting on posts (and explaining your reasons in the message box) is preferable to calling out on the offending party yourself ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
